rounds.response:
The board is [2♠, A♣, 6♥, 7♣].  
I hold 2♣ 3♥, so I have one-pair (the pair of deuces on board). There is no flush or straight possible for me, and the board now has some modest drawing value for an overcard-broadway hand (holding two cards higher than seven, hoping to hit one of them would improve to one-pair A). My current hand is very weak and likely crushed by any ace, six, seven, or overpair/wheel straight possibilities.

Player 0 has already shown willingness to call flop bets with wide-ish ranges (the flop bet+call history), so I will not get many folds with additional aggression. My best move is to control the size of the pot – since I am first to act on the turn, I will elect to check back, keeping the pot small.

[Check]
